greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ranks in natural order of 2^n increasing real numbers appearing in limit cycles of interval iterations, or Median Spiral Order.
reference: J. Demongeot, J. Waku, Some computational aspects of interval iterations and applications in demography and physiology, preprint 2007
J. Demongeot, J. Waku, Counter-examples for the population size growth in demography. Math. Pop. Studies, 12, 199-210 (2005).
link: J. Demongeot, J. Waku, Counter-examples for the population size growth in demography, Math. Pop. Studies 12 (2005), 199-210.
formula: a(n, 2k-1) = a(n-1, k), if we order the 2^n first integers a(n, 2k) = 2^n + 1 - a(n, 2k-1)
results.author: J. Demongeot (Jacques.Demongeot(AT)imag.fr), Jun 24 2007
